text: It would be an embarrassment if this restaurant is Mexican owned. Worst "Mexican" food ever. I've never been so disappointed in carne asada.

Slighty slow after midnight but the food was worth the wait! The portion on their tacos is huge and well worth the price. Tried fish and carne asada and both were top notch! Will definitely go back again.
Great tacos!!  I had a fish and a carnitas taco.  Both were delicious!!  The beans reminded me of my mom's.  Can't wait to try other items on the menu!!

Seriously overpriced raw tacos. Had to wait 30 minutes being that it's past midnight , was the only person there , and got raw chicken and raw Pork . Reviews must be fake because the 2 for 1 tacos at jack and the box are better . -5 stars .  Gross hope I don't get sick.

I tried this place after reading reviews and was super disappointed!! Adobada tacos hardly had any meat the carne asada nachos had red colored meat looked more like pastor! The horchata taste fake has a weird after taste! Frijoles has the best tacos in my opinion! I'd even choose Roberto's over this place
Great food!! Definitely have to try the carne asada fries  this was my first time coming here and I loved it.

My first time at The Apache Taco Shop . We went to celebrate our Cinco de Mayo after work . Did not want to sit in no big restaurant tonight so picked up a tamale dinner and it was good and my son got the Carne Asada Nachos and it was really good . The  Carne Asada  meat was tasty . Yes I will be back again and would love to try their tacos .

Apache Taco Shop is very good Mexican food at a very reasonable price. I had the Carne Asada taco plate, my friends had the Chicken plate, and the Carnitas plate. Tacos were all good size and the meat was very flavorful. The rice and beans were good, not blow your head off great, but good. A lil' salsa added to them definitely helped. 
That brings me to the only reason I am not offering the 5th star. The salsa, while decent flavor, really lacks some punch. If they can just make there salsa a little spicier (e.g....lil more peppers, garlic and salt) they would have me there as my go to new Mexican food spot.
The owner couldn't have been nicer, even offered us free drinks because it was our first time there. We want this place to stay,.....so go get yourself some tacos!

Clean friendly place small sits about 15 people , had breakfast burrito,  nothing to really blow up about it was fresh no seasoning to speak of. Can't make up my mind which salsa I like better on it but leaning towards the red then green and then the chunky one.  I was really looking for a sausage breakfast burrito, this on e had ham some bacon and I think chorizo, it was good just not what I wanted today. All in all would return to try other things
Chicken enchiladas are really good. Eat here almost everyday on my lunch break! Staff are very friendly!  This place I s a must go.
The sauce on the tacos is really good. Tacos are on the pricier end but they're filling.

Wow, what can we say? Almost here in Vegas from Los Angeles 1 year. It took this long to find our new taco shop. Mom is 78 years
old and had me call them while her mouth was full to tell them "this is the best tostada I've had in my life". They cook to order. Everything fresh, the place is spotless, so clean and the help is outstanding. Very, very good actually excellent customer service. We will be back. Most likely tomorrow to try the enchilada's.
Love you guys. Thank you.

Very nice people run this spot,  it took me about a year to come in and get a taco.  Now my wife makes me go and get her some asada tacos and my one year old devours the beans and rice.  Im a creature of habit so I usually get the asada burrito with everything in it and I've trying the asada fries both are delicious. This review is long over do.

Stopped in for the first time because of the reviews of the fish taco.  Very crisp and very generous portion. Was able to cut in half and make two tacos out of one. As a frequent traveler in baja Mexico the chipotle mayo sauce missed the mark... wish I would have asked for it on the side so I could taste the fish which is great and add my own salsa from their bar which is very nice.  I ate all the lettuce and slop first and then was able to enjoy it. Overall.. very good but skip the sauce. Thanks.

First time trying this place I can honestly say this place is amazing,

It's hard to find a place that can deliver delicious Mexican food here in Vegas. This place reminds me of the spots in LA and in Mexico,

This place is the best and the prices are very reasonable,  horchata was delicious

This place is worth coming back to eat again,

IDK how all these reviews are so great. My family and I just left this place first off the service was horrible nobody greeted us when we walked inn, the 2 cooks/cashier's looked too busy with the cash register I stood there for 5 min before being acknowledged, we ordered and where advised that only a few of there fountain drinks only worked..... Only 1 did actually work, we waited about 20 minutes to get our food my adobada WAS NOT cooked well. YUCK, the worst. The place was freezing inside so of course our food got cold right away! 

The food is a 3/10
Service 1/10
Cleanliness 4/10

1st and last time you live and you learn.
California burrito was AMAZING. Super fresh food and awesome customer service. The only place to go if you want mexican food in Summerlin!

Worst place I've been too. I was excited to try this place and when i finally went to try i was dissatisfied, disappointed and frustrated. This is my experience, i get there and the guy rudely asking for our order. We specifically asked for one torta with adobada and a wet burrito with green sauce and tounge and to drink we had tamarind water. When he took us our order he brought a wet red burrito and my torta and no drink. So i let him slide and a 1min later i politely asked about our drink so he says excuse me and he brings a horchata. So I've had it with getting the wrong everything so again politely i asked if we could get the tamarind water and he gets frustrated and started saying that we didnt order correctly and that he's just giving us what we ordered like we spoke to him in spanish and it seems like he doesn't even understand his own language. And to top it of the food has no flavor and the meat no salt and the guacamole tastes fake and im mexican i know mexican food and this place to have 4 stars... i dont get it. This place is crap to me im sorry but it could've just been my experience if other's have not had this experience thats good but i will never ever give them my money worst 27$ dollars spent i think i even got over charged . burrito was 7.99 torta 8.99 and the water i dont get how it came to so much money. If i could talk to the owner and get my money back i would appreciate it.  if i could give no stars i would.

Best tacos in Vegas! I had a fish and a shrimp taco; my husband had a wet burrito with chicken (green sauce) and it was all delish. We had the pleasure of meeting the owner and he insisted we try a Bolis (de leche) for free and that was tasty as well.

This is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas for the price and much better than most expensive places in Vegas,it's a long drive from the Vegas strip but well worth the drive.
The chicken tostadas are my favorite...
Enjoy

My husband and I visited on a Monday afternoon. It was our first day off together since moving to Las Vegas and we wanted something that felt familiar to us from our old days off: breakfast burritos. I decided to call since it was after 1 pm and I wanted to make sure they were still serving breakfast burritos, they assured me that they served them all day. 

When we arrived, we were greeted with warm smiles and patient waiting as we looked over the menu just in case something sounded better than the burritos. I asked how their breakfast burrito was normally prepared, the man at the register said it had: bacon, ham, sausage, eggs, potatoes and cheese. Ho-ly crap, my husband's eyes lit up. I consider myself a plain Jane and asked if there was any way I could have mine with JUST bacon and they happily accommodated me. 

Their seating space is limited (something I've come to be comforted by in smaller, intimate establishments) but my husband and I found a 2-top right by the window.  They brought our food to us at our table (an unexpected, but nice touch) and the burritos were as long as my forearm and twice as wide! Mine was very fresh, the bacon was the right amount of crispy and the cheese was melted beautifully.  

My husband wanted a bottled Mexican Coke from the refrigerator right behind us, he asked our original cashier if he could grab one and come to the register to pay but the man insisted that he take what he wanted and stay seated to enjoy his meal and just pay afterward.  A very small but sweet gesture.  When we finished our meal, we paid for the coke and thanked them for the food.  They thanked us for coming in and wished us a good day.  Great experience! I will be back this weekend.
Large portions, good prices and friendly service ! The food was fantastic and I'll definitely be back.

If you haven't already done so, do yourself a favor and try the fish tacos from Apache Taco Shop. 

My husband has been talking up these tacos for months, and after dragging my feet to try them, today I saw the light! 

I'm not generally a big white fish fan, but the Alaskan pollock was delicious! It was perfectly fried and gave a nice crunchy texture to the tacos. The portions were generous, so 2 tacos was more than enough. The sauce was super flavorful with a nice slow heat to it, and the produce on top was fresh. They also have a selection of freshly made salsas, though the fish tacos have a nice kick on their own. 

We will definitely be coming back next time our taco cravings hit!

I started with two hard shell carne asada taco's and my wife two hard shell carnitas taco's. The carne asada were so good had to have two more.  Wife said her carnitas were good also, she did not offer me a taste.  The sweet owner was there and gave my wife some flan that she said she had made.  Wife said it was excellent and fresh.  Kinda away from all the the action we normally go to Vegas for but an interesting other side of Vegas.
The owner if she is there is engaging and interesting.
Best Mexican food EVER!!! Nice to find a shop where employees truly like the owners and do their best to be sure all customers are happy and served quality food!  Will return often!
It took me a long time to find good Mexican food after moving to Vegas. Apache Taco is the real deal and the employees and owners are so friendly and efficient. You can NOT go wrong here. Amazing!

Great food everything is fresh and made to order
Salsa bar and Service are always excellent 
I usually order the carne Asada taco plate which comes with 2 tacos, rice and beans.
They also deliver how great is that!

So the first time i came here was because It was closer than robertos, but so glad that I did, now i come back here because the food quality is high end at fast food prices.  The food is fresh, the machaca is made with fresh cracked eggs that dont sit in a container all day, and this is by far the cleanest taco shop I have been to.  The spicy green taco sauce is awesome.  Today I'll try the poached marlin, carnitas, and adobada tacos... and the flan is home made.
This is my favorite taco shop! Anytime someone ask, I tell them to get the shrimp tacos.

I'm from southern California which objectively makes me an authority on taco shops so when I say the machaca burrito I had here was perfect you know that I'm sharing a fact with you, not an opinion

10/10 would consume again and again
Hurry in for a carnita pita taco.  It is a house original with a secret sauce!  Huge and delicious!   Staff  friendly!
The carne asada tacos are great and the salsa bar is pretty good, they have about 4-5 options with to little go cups. Open 24/7

I know this place has a lot of good reviews, but I honestly don't see how that many people think it's great. Have you folks never had real Mexican food? 

My boyfriend and I tried this place for the first time last night and we were not impressed.

This place is NOT real Mexican food. The beans had a grey milky tint to them and were entirely flavorless. The tortilla was soggy. Seriously, how do you mess up a bean and cheese burrito?!? What are these... Fake beans? Powdered beans? Yuck Yuck Yuck!! 

My boyfriend ordered a quesadilla and it looked like a taco.

I noticed they were advertising some seasonings and thought it was odd. 

We got an order of carne asada fries and they were terrible. First of all, who the hell makes carne asada fries with big fat steak fries?!? Yuck! The carne asada looked like chili and was very sausey. To top it off it was loaded with their seasoning. Yuck! Since when does carne asada fries have seasoning? I mean these were covered in a disgusting seasoning. The seasoning is really not appropriate for this dish. I'm fairly certain this was one of the seasonings advertised. Maybe some people like it, but it wasn't for us.

I gave it two stars because the place was really clean inside and the hot sauce was great. The service was also really good. 

This appears to be a one man show. I can see how that could be a problem at times. 

Perhaps I'm so disappointed because I'm from San Diego and know what real Mexican food tastes like! 

I really wish the owner would consider using higher quality ingredients. 

This place just isn't for us. Everything was a few dollars more than other places. With so many other taco shops to choose from, we won't be returning.

Both times I've been here there's only a single guy running the show: taking orders, making them, and serving them. All one guy. It's a lot for one person to handle.

Fish taco is huge- one is filling, but I'd personally ask for it without pico, as theirs has a ton of jalapeno in it that just overpowered the great fish for me. Burritos are a good size for a good price (under $5!), but you have to add on extras like cheese, sour cream, or guac. Still not a bad deal.

Salsa bar has five different options, all of which were tasty in their own way. Signage suggests customers only take what they need for their current meal, which strikes me as odd seeing as how fresh salsa doesn't actually keep all that long and this place has never been busy.

Came here in the middle of the night with a taco craving, but once I got there I decided to try the carne asada torta. They have pictures of some items and my mouth watered as soon as I saw pictures of the torta!
There was one guy working and he was super friendly and had great customer service. 
The seating is limited but I went at night so I was the only one there with my boyfriend. I appreciated that the food was super fresh and I could see him cooking it. I've had problems at Robertos where the food is sitting and then just slabbed in a tortilla and put on the grill.
My torta was very flavorful, I enjoyed the things that came on it (pico, guac, sour cream) but what ruined it was the carne asada. While the flavors were great, the meat itself was cut thick and just SUPER chewy. I thought I was being picky until my boyfriend said the same thing. It made it really difficult to eat and enjoy because it took so much effort to bite in and rip the meat apart...not to mention the work of chewing tough thick carne asada! 
The salsas they offer were all delicious..i couldn't differentiate which one was best because they were all great. One however was very spicy, if you enjoy heat you will probably enjoy it because it isn't unbearable...just really hot!
I also ordered a horchata and 3 caramel churros. The horchata was a typical horchata, nothing amazing about it. The churros were fresh and delicious but I honestly couldn't taste or feel any of the caramel inside. I complain because I ate all 3 and they were so good!
Overall I wish I had went with tacos..I love tacos el gordo and pinches tacos so I was hoping to find another competitor. Haven't decided if I will go back to try more!

I was so excited to try this place but wow was I disappointed. We ordered the 3 roll chicken taco, fish taco, carne asada fries and flan. None of them were good nor was it appetizing. Also the pricing have gone up and nothing was worth it.  I will never be going back to this place. They also have a $.50 credit card charge which they don't tell you about and just change you. Really annoyed by this place.

Everything about this place was wrong. Not sure who thinks this place is even half decent. Have you guys not had real Mexican food??? The rice is terrible no flavor the beans are equally bad. Not to mention they got the order wrong. I guess no pico means extra pico. Went there once and never going back. Robertos is 10 times better and cheaper!

I came here for the first time and this is my new taco shop the kindest people cooking up amazing food makes for an absolute pleasurable experience. You can taste the love in the food. Great food fast service. 24/7.
I love the carne asada fries here. They give you this special sauce that is out of this world. The prices on their items are one of the best in Vegas. One of my favorite mexican food spots in town
Such a great find and it's open 24/7!! Tasty food that's fresh and great service!! The carne asada fries and the fish tacos are our faves!!

I was really excited to try this place bc of all the reviews, but I was disappointed. The fish and shrimp tacos were just ok. Decent flavors, size was good, but Ive had a lot better. I could tell the fish/shrimps were frozen and ended up rubbery. They smother it in medium heat salsa. The carne asada fries were better, but different. Fat seasoned potatoes with this weird cream sauce Ive never had. The meat was delicious and the only best part, with lots of white cheese. BUT it had no salsa or even guacamole. Customer service was great, but I probably wont be back.

I've eaten here several times now & the chile rellenos are always perfect! The owner is super friendly & remembered me after the first visit. I had my carnitas taco made into a tostada today & it was to die for, though you do need to eat it quick before the center gets soggy. They need to put that option on the menu! They also deliver. LOVE this place!

I have eaten here 3 separate times and on all 3 visits the food was fantastic. Summerlin doesn't have many options for authentic tacos but this place is a gem. I highly recommend the fish tacos and the carne asada fries.
The tacos were delicious. Fish taco and Carne Asada taco were the best. Couple other meats or not as tasty. The tacos are much bigger than any other places. Friendly staff.

Great tacos! Had the carne asada tacos and there is a deep flavor to the meat that you don't get at other taco shops around here. 

Really liked stopping in at odd hours and finding a warm and clean taco shop. The habanero salsa was good and very interesting, had a strong quality to it and went really well on the tacos.

Pickled jalapenos were perfect, would have liked spicy carrots too.

Excellent shop!

Wanted to see what all the rage was about with this place since I've heard good things and seen some of their reviews. The only time I am in the plaza they are located in, I'm usually grabbing a shawarma laffa from next door at Shawarma Vegas which never lets me down btw. I tried the chilaquiles and my boyfriend got the california burrito. His burrito looked and smelled delicious, but it seemed a bit small. He scarfed it down in seconds. My chilaquiles were decent. The two fried eggs were cooked just how I like em. I appreciated the flavor of the overall dish, but the chips were overly soggy. My beans also came with a present from the chef.. a nice, curly hair on top. Kinda made me lose my appetite and also disappoint me for not going to my normal go to spot which is shawarma Vegas.  Lesson learned lol. I think next time I'll try their tacos.

I've been going here for about a year now mainly for breakfast burritos they're unbelievably good. People are very nice to me Everytime I visit as well, good job Apache you're definitely my favorite Mexican place in town.
Got a burrito and a quesadilla for like 14 bucks and they were stuffed w meat, so good!!! Definitely go back, guy at the counter was spacey but cool. I'd definitely recommend this ppace

I'm a big fan of Mexican food. Tacos being my favorite. We ended up ordering more than we should but that's always the case when I go out to eat. By the time I finished ordering, we ended up with the carne asada fries... loads of fries piled high with chili, cheese and the works. Delicious I might add in. My husband had the beef chimichanga with guacamole and sour cream on the side, I got a few bites in also. I had the Chile's rellenos served with rice and beans which was very good. I also had to have my carne asada tacos. Really great. All the food was pretty good and they gave us complimentary churros. Outstanding service and great food. Definitely recommend this place, you won't be disappointed
Terrible. Worst food ever and way over priced. The 4 stars and comments are very misleading!!
Love this Taco Shop.  We do order the sauce on the side as it is very spicy but very very good.

I love finding local taco shops. Sometimes they are hit or miss on flavor & quality. This place has both. My hubby and I had fish tacos, carne asada fries and a Wet Burrito. They were amazing. The was awesome we stuffed ourselves silly. The prices were great. We will be coming back here for sure.

Really great find! It's several steps above the competition. My recommendations would be the tacos which cost a bit more than some places, but worth it. Other great choices are the burritos and the tortas although for at least one member of the family the chipotle salsa was too hot. Speaking of which, I also really like the salsa bar because it has not only 1, but 4 interesting choices. The only somewhat negative note was for the asada nachos which didn't come with as much meat as we're used to.
Tacos adobada are great, as well as everything else!  Chips were very fresh and the salsa is definitely homemade!!

Ssssh, don't rat me out but I'm writing this review from work because I'm just too excited!

Decided to try something new at the apache taco show and am so glad I did. Got the fish taco and no joke it's the BEST fish taco I've ever had. Before my favorite was wahoos but the flavor, and size of apaches fish taco blew wahoos away. It's tender, not fishy, fried outside that crunchy, not soggy. For 2.99 it was huge and I wish I would have gotten a second. The chipotle sauce they put on it gives it a kick that really brings out the flavor. They don't skimp on the cabbage and put it on two corn tortillas that don't break. 

The second taco I got was still good, marinated chicken. I found out you can get it on a flour tortilla too but I stuck with corn. So much meat that you could almost order another corn tortilla ad stuff another. Great prices for portions, and I find myself having more food than I can eat. 

Rice and beans taste super fresh, and again I love I watch them make everything and grill it. 

What's new as well is that they changed their salsa bar and now I can't stop raving. They added a new chunky green mild one that packs a punch after you start chewing. And they spiced up their salsa, the brown chunky one. Now I have no complaints! This is the perfect taco place for me. (sorry tacos la Mexicana!)
Great service, hot sauce bar was very clean and the salsas were all fresh and taste great. Fast service....will come back again..

Meats for all items on the menu aren't cooked until you place your order. Wait time is still reasonable for such freshly prepared food. Not a fast food joint. Seating is limited but available. Big take out business too.

I haven't even started the food at the beginning here but this shop is just amazing. Peggy and her husband are the sweetest, kindest people you'll ever meet. They are dog friendly and just a pleasure to talk to. The shop is clean and the food, well the food after this first bite is amazing. Go here, go here often and say howdy to peggy.

Gaaahrrrooosss. Not impressed. I will never return. No flavor and too pricey. Carne asada was too chewy, tamale was a weird grey color with some random marinara tasting sauce and the adoboda had no flavor at all. Worst taco joint I have been To in Vegas, and I have been to a lot.

This place is so delicious! My boyfriend and I just recently found it and we've been hooked ever since. The food is always on point and the service is friendly and fast. They also deliver and are open 24 hours! Our favorite!!!
Great food and very nice owners. The fish tacos are thebomb.com. Definitely worth a try for yourself, I try to eat here at least a couple times a month.

I've lived in Vegas for 18 years and this is the best taco shop I've ever been to hands down. The quality of their food is amazing and their prices are fair. I could literally eat here everyday. You guys have to try their carne asada fries, it's the best shit ever!!! And I love how they put guacamole on their sopes! Most places like to charge extra for it. This place is AMAZING, I hope nothing changes. You guys definitely need more locations!

Finally I have found a delicious taco shop close to home. Authentic with fresh ingredients. Service is quick even though there is only one man running the place. This will definitely remain my goto spot for homemade mexican food.

My carne asada torta was terrible. The meat marinade made it seem store bought and it was so tough I could barely eat it. Was hoping for an authentic west side Mexican spot. Um...you better fix it guys, cause that meal sucked.

It's 12:45am and it's still opened. Not a lot of seating but if you find an empty table they have nice cushiony chairs. 

Carne asada Tacos and nachos are good. What makes them stand out tho is the variety of specialty sauces! I also love the fact that they are opened 24 hours.
Our family are regular visitors to Apache! Our son Erik is there several times a week. They make things, just how you want. Their carnitas are the bomb! I would highly recommend them to anyone!

OK so fish tacos!! Was never really a huge fan but after reading many reviews in general about them and this west coast taco obsession craze thing going on I decided to give it a whirl. I must have passed this place a thousand times and caught the indian head out front and not go in. First thing is this is a one man show, he takes the order and makes the food, so prepare for a short wait. 

I ordered a fish taco and a chicken taco with a cup of water. As soon as I paid he washed his hands at the sink behind the counter which is always good to actually see. WARNING..if you pay with a credit/debit card you will have to pay .50 cent surcharge, not stingy just saying. The taco sauce bar had a selection of 5 sauces, all of which range from mild to their spicy chipotle sauce. I like when restaurants put the food rating right where you can see it instead of being hidden in some back window somewhere, it is located directly in front of register. It always reassuring to see that A rating.

The fish taco was MASSIVE and crunchy. The ingredients tasted fresh and it was meaty or fishy I should say. It was the best fish taco I've ever had, the server was super friendly and even changed the channel to an english speaking channel, antique road show rocks! I will probably never go back to Robertos ever again after coming here,  would also like to try other stuff on the menu. This is a mom and pop shop, family run and close to home.

BTW me and Ellen F. ate for $14.00!! Awesome value for what you get. I wanted to eat some more but dinner plans suddenly came up and I was eating so couldn't get stuffed. We will def be coming back for more really soon, they open at 7am. Say hi to spiderman!! You can catch him hanging around the register on a rack.

Craving tacos after visiting Red Rock Canyon, so I searched yelp and found this spot. We weren't super hungry so we just got a few. Brendan tried the chicken taco and loved it. I had the shrimp taco and the veggie taco. The shrimp taco was really good- fresh slaw, chipotle sauce, corn tortilla and breaded shrimp... yum. The veggie taco was more like a burrito, as there was refried beans and rice in it. I did not love it, but it wasn't terrible. The salsa bar was really awesome, we loved the mild salsa and the fresh limes made all of the difference on our tacos. Delicious!
The best hard taco I have had in all of Las Vegas! He slow marinates all of his meet and the Salsa is homemade and fresh!!! Nom Nom

Amazing fish tacos!  The prices are outstanding for everything you get.  Two large fish tacos, rice, and beans $8.99. The refried beans were great as was the rice.  Add in the salsa bar with so many options.  I love that it is local too.

This place is really good. I tried the fish taco contest at a taco and Carnitas taco and they were all perfect. Also the salsas are some of the best I've ever had. A very good late-night spot. Tip- ask for the wet burrito in a to go container because the paper they use on the tray gets soggy.
Went here today with my family and all I have to say is WOW. It was great service and great food. Super clean inside! I am so glad that I found this spot and I will be back often and very soon!

Im not sure what changed but the last time we got food here it just wasnt good, fries in the carne asada fries were soggy and mushy, hardly any meat, and very very greasy. The wet burrito was okay, but very small compared to previous visits. Food was overall kinda bland, hopefully it doesnt stay this way because we really loved the food here.

Nice little taco shop in a neighborhood not too far from Summerlin.  I like the faux brick making it feel as if you are in a rustic town, and not a suburb of Las Vegas.  The place is clean and neat, and well organized.  One of the most appealing salsa bars I've been to for Mexican food. Tells you they take it seriously.  The al pastor and other taco staples are done well.  It's not so amazing that it garners 5 stars, and I would not go crazy out of my way to return, but they know what they're doing, provide good value, and you should not feel worried to try it here.  Also, it seems like it's family-owned.  I like that.  Support the mom's and pop's!

I usually chafe at the idea of spending $3 for a single taco, but these tacos are thicc and satisfying. And in my limited experience (I'm no taco expert), it's not easy to find tacos this good in this part of town after midnight. 

I've tried the fish, shrimp, and carnitas so far. And I highly recommend the shrimp and carnitas. I'm not super taco savvy, but this is the best carnitas taco I've had in a while. I love it with some of their habanero salsa on there. 

Detour for Habanero Salsa - I love it when I taste a truly spicy salsa. Green and Red are nice to have, but the habanero is a real treat.

 The shrimp taco literally bursts at the seams when i try to hold it using one tortilla. I generally like to eat my tacos using one tortilla, but this one always busts it. 

I'm giving it four stars for now, but only because I don't feel like I have enough taco experience under my belt to get too crazy with my praise, but I'll definitely be back to try my favorites and try some of their other tacos. 

(Also I tried the street tacos which were closer to what I think you get when you go to El Gordo or Taco Y Taco. The street tacos are $2 each and are pretty underwhelming for me which is in line with my general feeling about street tacos. My only really stand out experience so far was a tripas one at Taco Y Taco where the nice taco server deep-fried the tripas for me.)

I have been here several times, and never disappointed.

I like to judge a taco shop by their tacos, I am funny that way!

First time I got 3 tacos...
1 Fish Taco -Delicious! and huge! two fish tacos, and I could be done!
1 Lengua Taco -If you don't know what that is, you might not want to order. OK it is beef tongue.  I love them, when done right! At Apache it was tender and flavorful!
1 Carnitas Taco - Perfect classic!

The ONLY thing that could have made the tacos better would be homemade tortillas.
And yes, I know it is a lot of work! (But one of the things I adore about Pinches Tacos in container park!) So I can hope!

I have also ordered Carnitas Torta - Also really amazing! tender meat, super fresh bread. 

Great little place! Happy to have it in the hood!

Great 24 hour mom and pop taco shop. All the meat is cooked fresh right on their grille. This place is pure quality and reasonably priced. The 2 owners are wonderful people and it's easy to become fans of theirs!

Today, my boyfriend and I were looking for a new place to grab some lunch and we stumbled upon Apache Taco Shop! The woman working there, Peggy, was so kind and helped us while we decided on what to eat.

I had the chicken pita taco and my boyfriend ordered the shrimp taco platter. Both were really great and we recommend trying them! 

We also had two of the frozen treats they had there. I tried the mango and my boyfriend tried the lime---soooo good. My kind of treat!

This place is great! They're 24/7 which is great for when we got hungry at 2am. The tacos are tasty, the nachos are piled with cheese, and the service is really the best. Peggy is a sweetheart! They food came very quick too. I would definitely suggest trying this place!
Went there at like 6 on a Monday and they were closed.. Weird... Hopefully after trying a fish taco all these reviews rave about I'll be inclined to change this review

FINALLY! I have been on a search for good Mexican food ever since I moved to Vegas from southern California two and a half years ago. This place did not miss the mark.  I ordered two chicken tacos with cheese. The flavor of the chicken was perfect and all of the salsa at the salsa bar was fresh. The man who took my order (the owner?) was also very friendly and  made efforts to make sure I was satisfied with my meal.  It was a great experience. The only disappointment is that I live in Henderson and this taco shop is a half hour away from me. I would come here regularly if I lived closer. Muchísimas gracias!

Yum! Yum! Gimme Some!!! I have been on this crazy cravings escapade for Mexican Food! I really like to venture out and try different places around my side of town and decided to hit this taco joint up! First of all let's just say that it's a million Taco shops in Las Vegas so being able to separate yourself from the rest is important. I have been trying to not always go to Roberto's because the last few times just haven't been consistent. Apache Taco Shop is 24hrs which earned them their first set of brownie points! When I arrived last night it was only one guy working and he was super friendly and fast! The previous good reviews on the fish tacos are what pushed my decision on what to order my first time around. I tell you what though I couldn't have made a better choice! Two fish tacos followed by one carnitas taco completed my order! The tacos are huge! For $2.95 I believe it was very well worth it. Now comparing them to some of the other main competitors of taco shops in Las Vegas they level out to be somewhat similar. There are some items though that are priced a tad bit higher but nonetheless it's pretty much the same. I will be coming back more frequently that's a bet!

I've driven by this place so many times and I've always wanted to try it. Finally, tonight I tried it. There is only one man working. He takes the order, cooks the food, just little old him. I don't mind, I just feel sorry for him that he has to do everything alone. It's a small restaurant. I almost walked into the wrong restaurant next door to it bc it's so hidden. I ordered the shrimp taco and chicken taco. And some chips and salsa. I ordered 5 tacos total. My total was $18 and some change. The guy was nice, food was pretty good. The shrimp tacos were my favorite so far. Tasted authentic and I enjoyed every bite. The chicken taco was ok. The chicken was dry and seemed a little old. Maybe it's been sitting there a while. All the salsa are yummy. I saw the other reviews that said that they deliver. I got sooo excited but when I asked the guy, he said they only deliver mornings now bc he is all alone at night. Awwww :( I like this place. Taste like the real thing.

Mmm! We got the taquito plate with rice and beans and an asada torta. Everything was delicious and didn't take too long. Yesterday was our first time here and we came for dinner. Well, we're back today for lunch and we got the taquitos because they are just so good. There's definitely a spice factor too. I noticed when biting into my torta last night that there are chopped jalapeños in the guac. I LOVE it but it's definitely hot! Get an horchata to help with that ;)
Worst chicken burrito in town. Tasteless, no chicken and all rice. I wouldn't go back.

My coworker brought me a pollo plate from this restaurant. The chicken was delicious!! It tastes flame grilled and fresh, seasoned very well and is thigh meat which I prefer. The rice was good. It also came with beans which I liked but were a little bit bland. It came with guacamole which was also bland BUT the salsa verde was delicious. It was flavorful and had some heat. I mixed the guac with the salsa which was good. The plate also came with two hot corn tortillas which were great. I really enjoyed my meal.

My husband and I tried this place because of all the reviews about the fish tacos. And they were right! The tacos are amazingly delicious. The fish is huge and they pile on the toppings. I ordered two tacos but got full off of one. 

The beans and salsa are also very good with a lot of flavor. 

So glad we found this place!!

We were looking for a place to eat and stumbled across this small taco shop not far from our home. It's a small and quant place next to a gas station. I would not call this place a hole in the wall or dive but just like most hole in the wall family owned restaurants this one rocks! The food is authentic, you can tell immediately that you are in for a real authentic meal. We have been here many times and I have to say my favorite is their fish tacos and their homemade chips. Yes they actually make each bag of tortilla chips from scratch by slicing up tortillas and frying them. Most Mexican food in general bloats my stomach and gives me indigestion, but not Apache Taco! It must be because they use only fresh ingredients and no crap or fillers. We will definitely be ordering from them again in the future, in fact perhaps we will order in and have them deliver this evening. If you are looking for a quick meal try apache taco instead of Taco Bell or Dell Taco for a healthier option.

This Mexican food spot is great for being that it's located in summerlin. My boyfriend and I come here atleast once a week to order the carne asada fries with the chipotle sauce. I like to order my fries well done so it has a nice golden crisp on the potato. I also love the fact that it's open 24/7. Only thing is they typically have different workers everyday and they aren't consistent with the quality of food but I mean still good none the less. This place is honestly the only real Mexican food I consider in Vegas being that I'm from LA.

This place is amazing! If I ever want quick street tacos or enchiladas, I never go elsewhere. The cook is super quick and the taste is as good as a quality Mexican restaurant, better than most! Chile rellano is a must if that's your go to dish, and as basic as a cheese quesadilla is, it's so good, I must steal a piece from my child everytime!

Not very many mexican good options in summerlin. We love their secret fry sauce. This is good even on pizza! Its an iconic sauce in Guanajuato where I am from and so are the owners. Maybe I am biased because of it. Haha.
Anyway we love their chilaquiles! Usually do green sauce. Thats a go to item for us. We ask for them to add either chicken or carne asada for an extra charge. Totally don't mind. 
Their tortas are also very delicious. 
Horchata is always on point as well.

First off, customer service is really great. I'd like to put that out there first. I don't see that too often at taco shops. I ordered a enchilada plate and a tamale. The enchilada sauce they use is not very tasty and the chicken is chunky chicken and I guess I'm used to shredded in enchiladas. The tamale was ok, but nothing I would get again. $8.25 for my plate and 0.75 charge for using a card. I will try them one more time but only for tacos.

The carne asada fries are sooooo good. I love that they use the seasoned steak fries, and the seasoning on the meat was great too. The place was super clean and small. The food took a while, but it was worth the wait. Will definitely be going back.
This place was amazing. Great carne asada tacos and fresh chips and salsa. The fish tacos are great also!

On my first visit here I had chicken tacos that were ok. However, I tried the veggie burrito and torta last night and they were both absolutely dreadful. I couldn't eat either. Nasty, mushy, over cooked veggies. Horrible congealed lumpy cheese and way too much watery sour cream. A real waste of money and time as it all went in the garbage. I will never return.
Best carne asada nachos I've had in a long time! Can't wait to try everything else here. Tastes so fresh.

I thought the service was fine and the place was clean. So I am giving it two stars. We had three burritos all different. They were terrible. There was no flavor and very little meat. I would not eat there again if you were paying.

Dude..    I keep looking for the Taco...    the one that I can write about in loving terms...    the one I can make my go to Taco...      still havent found it but these are good...    really good.    

This place isn't pretending to be anything its not...    its a little place...    4 tables...    right next to a gas station...     but what they do, they do darn well.

I should really say...    since I have bee reviewing tacos lately...     that I keep looking for the taco that comes close to the taco I had in Tampa Florida...   Place called Caiifornia Tacos to-go.    By far the BEST I'VE EVER HAD.    I think that there fish tacos could solve the middle east peace process....   ( Ok   I my like them too much...   my bad..    I digress)

Now Apache...    cool vibe...    The owner is there and he has a great sense of humor.    He led us throught the choices and we sat and got our food...      good...    really really good and at a pretty darn great value as well.    

Oh and another thing...   if you're close by...    you have them as a choice for delivery.   I cant tell you how many times I wanted somthing delivered, but didnt want Pizza or Chinese...     Yes tacos are now a delivery option.

Listen...   may not be a regular, but I will be back and really...    if your in the mood for a taco, just go...   you wont be dissapointed.

We came here last night because I really wanted a shrimp burrito and we wanted to try a new place. I asked if they could make the burrito not spicy as I can't handle hot foods. I was told yes but when I got home I ended up not eating it since it had jalapeños in it, I had to give it away. On the other hand the tacos were pretty good and I loved the flan which is why I gave it a 4 stars.

Love this place!
Good, fresh food used in 
Authentic recipes..  
Friendly customer service.  
Makes buying local a pleasure.

If you like your Mexican food Mexican, this is the place! Fresh salsa bar, friendly people, and the enchiladas are my now girl's fave in town. Personally, I like the tostada. It's piled high with goodness and the guacamole and fresh cilantro are so nice to my taste buds. I'm loving the Mexican bottled coke to go with everything. And don't miss the FRESH FLAN! With so many options in this area, this place is the real deal, a sure thing in Vegas.

Really nice guys! The fish tacos are the perfect size to have a good meal and are the best I've ever had. The spicy/creamy sauce that they put on them is incredible. If I could eat there everyday, I would! My husband is also a fan of the carne asada fries.

This is absolutely hands down the best taco place ever I always get a breakfast burrito it is never greasy like another well-known place that I used to go to and they're so so far is Kick-Ass I could sit there and drink a gallon of it anyway check it out I can only hope it doesn't get too popular because I like to have the place all to myself
amazing people! peggy is just a sweetie  and they take care good of ya and are just wonderful people! try the menudo!!! it's amazing!

Love this place is close to home!!  I love the flavor of their tacos.  Sure there's another place near my house (won't name).  My husband amd I eats here like at least once a week.  The first time we discovered Apache Taco, we went there "twice" in a day!!
High quality meat with tons of flavor! Huge portions! They cook everything upon ordering!

Good food and service. We tried a little of everything since this was our first time here.  The best part was the carne asada quesadilla.  It had so much meat and cheese.  The salsa bar is pretty legit also and it has 5 different salsas.after I selected my salsa the nice cashier lady came over and brought me a bag to put them in so they didn't spill.  Next was the bean and cheese burrito enchilada style.  The carnitas weren't that great but they weren't bad.  The carne asada taco was good but Would of been better With some avocado and less onion.  If you're in the area you should for sure Check them out.

This is mine and my wife's number one Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas! Starting from the services to the quality of the food. When you walk in your are greeted right away with a worm smile. Once you place your order that's when the meet fits the grill no reheating at all. Hands down best place to eat! Amazing quality!!!
Their fish tacos are amazing. Awesome crunch, perfect fish-tortilla ratio, shredded cabbage, sauce, a sauce to top it off make this my favorite fish taco in Vegas!

The food is good if they can get your order right. Went at 11 pm on a Sunday night. Asked for a burrito, add cheese and sopes, no tomato. There was no cheese on the burrito and there was tomatoes on the sopes. The guy also forgot the beans and rice that came with the sopes. I literally had to repeat the order 5 times for the guy and I still had to do 2 transactions because he forgot something I asked for. I'm not sure if he was just tired, out of it, or on something but either way it makes eating here difficult.
STRAIGHT FIRE!!!! if your looking for a cool lil mexican job w good food this the spot!! whoever disagree y'all trippin 5 stars y'all playin
I love this little taco joint owned by nice couple. Food is so authentic and made freshly. Edward the owner super nice person and he make sure your food is delicious. Highly recommended

I am shocked by the good reviews.  Had much higher expectations than what I experienced. The tortillas on the enchiladas and tacos were not good. The adobada meat was mealy tasting, the enchilada meat was fatty and the Asada had a dish water taste to it.  I like spicy salsas, but all of their salsas were very hot and the radishes on the salsa bar were not fresh...they were rubbery.  I truly hate to bash on a local taco shop but I basically just threw $25 worth of food in the trash.  Stick to Roberto's or even better, Tacos El Gordo.

I don't understand how some people on here are writing 4 star reviews but giving this place a 3 star rating....this place's food quality is absolutely outstanding. Just because this place was not able to suit your special little needs does not mean that objectively it is a 3 star restaurant according to Yelp standards. This place is outstanding, especially for the price, and is definitely worth at least a try.

Nice people but 1) the carne asada burrito has too much rice and beans in it and  2)  The rolled tacos were kinda squishy.  I am sticking to Roberto's for my taco shop fix even though Roberto's is nothing compared to the good taco shops in So. Cal.

Had to kill some time waiting for a place to open.  Stopped in at apache and got a enchilada plate, red, cheese, actually white cheese that was melted.  I was shocked to be honest.  The sauce did seem to be tomato based which I'm not a huge fan of but it tasted pretty good.  Also at 6 bucks for that plate cheaper than most.

Really wanted to like this place, the pictures looked so good online. I live in Summerlin so pretty far from Tacos el Gordo so I was hoping this place had decent Mexican food unfortunately it was not to be. First their Carne Asada was over seasoned but not in a good way, I thought maybe they cooked it with chorizo and that is why it was that particular color but unfortunately it was no the meat was over salty, I ordered a Torta but they don't use mayo or even Mexican crema which has a better taste then sour cream but they use generic sour cream instead, I had to ask for them to put beans in it, the weird wheat bollilo they use is vaguely edible. My nachos were really stingily cheesed, hey just cause I ordered in English doesn't mean I don't speak Spanish, I heard when he told the lady "no le heches mucho queso" don't put a lot of cheese. Again the meat was just a salty mess and the chips were store bought cheap dollar store stale chips, which is Sad when places like la Bonita is a short distance away and sells fresh made chips in giant bags. My brother quesadilla was made with a regular size flour tortilla nothing special but for $5 it should have been at least bigger then the dollar ones at taco bell. So the break down for this place is honestly nothing was good. You want a burrito go across the street to chipotle it would be a lot tastier then this place, for tacos make the Drive to Tacos el Gordo, so delicious and worth it versus this place, that truly is real carne asada Mexican style, you want nachos or quesadillas go to Taco Bell cheaper and all though not truly Mexican style a lot tastier. Lastly if you want a Mexican food experience over all head to La Bonita, You'll thank me this place was truly underwhelming and left a bitter flavor in my mouth.
This is my go-to taco shop! The food is incredible and the customer service is beyond satisfying. I LOVE this place! Thank you Apache taco team.

Food isn't too bad. The tacos are over priced for no reason ... & they charge u 50 cents to use ur card if u don't have cash. $2.75 for regular tacos just a bit much ? , taco y taco is better & they are $2.25 each , the taco truck which is also better is $2.00 each ... so there goes that.

I come here at least 3x a week. Love this place! I always make sure to come when the owner is in. He is what makes this place special. Him and his wife are such nice people. When he cooks for you, you can clearly tell the difference because he cooks with care. I truly mean that. The food is so good! This place is NOT one of those gross taco chains like Robertos up the street. They use fresh REAL ingredients, which makes the food taste as if you made it at home. Mom/Pop establishments like this, is what society's missing these days.  :)

P.S. - Try the shrimp taco, they're the best!

Very tasty Mexican food! The owner (I think?) is also seems like a super nice guy. We had the California burrito and the fish burrito on one visit, then came back to get adobada tacos and a bean & cheese burrito on a second visit. Everything was excellent. Beware that the spicy salsas are actually spicy (and delicious). Come for some great late night food!

OMG!!! Ok so a little background of me so you can understand.... We live in RI and came to Vegas for a week anyhow my hubby is Israeli and Everytime we leave home our search for good Israeli food begins.  We come to Vegas almost every year and usually eat next door but we had no idea panini was open for bfast... Most Israeli places here open at 11 and we want to have real bfast not buffet ... Anyhow we got here at 10 an Israeli lady named Gila  greeted us she was so charming and immediately the Hebrew started flowing my husband's eyes lit up.... ( He felt home lol) anyhow they have everything !!! We ordered hummus, a panini toast with emek cheese ( Israeli cheese) and abtwist of pesto for mua! Lol anyhow it came with a salad and delish.... Hence we couldn't finish it and taking everything to the track( my hubby is racing ) we also ordered shakshuka which was perfectly spiced up.... I love harif!! ( Spicy food) then we ordered Israeli salad which was great usually other places don't season it but this one had lemon salt and olive oil... The first thing that came out was a trio of salads red cabbage , corn and babaganoosh... the three were fresh and the baba it was home made you could feel the grilled eggplant... Which I love a lot of places simply buy it but when I taste the grill well it's a home run to me! Then oshri came... I think he's the owner and if not he was so nice and had great attention to detail which is a plus... I studied hospitality and attention to the small details always get to me.... In others words if u want Israeli food def come by it def reminded me of being home!!! Thank u panini cafe I will be back tomorrow morning ;)

Don't be fooled by the 24 hours & reasonable prices! This is fine Mexican cuisine made with excellent quality ingredients that put every other Mexican restaurant I've tried in Vegas to shame. The five choices of fresh homemade salsa is a treat indeed. This mom & pop joint even offers marlin on their fish tacos. This place is a must try if you're craving something other than all you can eat sushi. I spent 7.00 and I'm so full right now WOW!!! Oh...the street tacos are massive. Enjoy!!!

First time coming here and I ordered the chili Rellenos plate for myself and a carna asada burrito for my husband. I was very please  with the size of the chili relleno but was very disappointed with the sauce on top. It taste just like a cheap can of spaghetti sauce and looked like it too! Terrible flavor killed the whole meal, not to mention the rice was extremely dry and hard.
My husband said his carne asada was good but wish they out more in the burrito. The burrito would have been more enjoyable if there weren't any of the hard dried up rice inside of it. The beans were ok. Weren't watery and runny like other places can be.

My girlfriend and I got hungry late night and went for tacos. The food was way different from other taco place like Robertos. The owner came up to my girlfriend and I and said that their food is all freshly made. Like the sauce for the carne asada fries is to die for!!
The wet Burrito was delicious and I got extra sour cream! And boy did they load you up with that! Great job!

This place has been bookmarked for awhile and I drive pass it all the time. Finally tried it out tonight. I ordered a California Burrito with a large Soda. The burrito was huge. The tortilla taste fresh and all the ingredients and inside. It was my first time ordering a California burrito. I didn't know what was inside. Realized it was Carne Asada, Quac, Potatoes, Sour Cream and cheese. Everything was great. BUT, I take away a star because there was just wayyyy to much Carne Asada for my liking, and the Guac / Sour Cream was globbed on one side of the burrito so a few bites were straight sour cream. 

I see there were other great reviews so I am open to coming back and trying other things on the menu.
The food was too spicy for me. I personally was unable to enjoy any of the salsa because the flavor was overpowered by the spice. That is just me though.

Authentic Mexican food! I love this place! It's so good, it's addicting! Have been back 3 times in a week! I need to start controlling myself lol. Eddie and Peggy are the sweetest, the make my experience a memorable one very time. Certainly recommend Apache to everyone.
These place is awful filthy and way overcharge ever charged me .75 cent for using a credit card with a $21 for 2 burritos will NEVER go there again

Got the adobada burrito, was mostly rice with hints of meat in it.  Flavor of the rice was farely bland but the meat wasnt bad. On top of that I had to wait 20 minutes for my food while being 1 of 2 people there.

I've found it -- the best fish tacos in town!! $3 for a massive fried marlin filet topped with spicy pico de Gallo, cabbage, and a creamy sauce. They're so big they're practically open-faced tacos. The chicken is just as good and flavorful. I've been here at least half a dozen times and have not gotten anything else besides their tacos- why fix what's not broken?! Apache Tacos makes me hesitant to get fish tacos anywhere else in town. 
Salsa bar is always well stocked and cleaned. Spice levels are great. Open 24/7 for late night taco cravings. 
Just a note- there is a 50 cent charge for paying with credit/debit card.

I was looking for late-night (after 9 PM) eats, and this happened to be close to our hotel. I wasn't expecting much, but this was a find! I got a carne asada burrito, and my girlfriend got a fish taco.

The fish taco is the thing to get! It's spicy, though. Definitely, this is a place worth going to if you're looking for something late. Food is good quality, and it's not your typical 24-hour place. 

Restaurant was clean and nicely lit - not like the 24-hour places I frequent in LA. I'd be willing to come back here if I was out late again and wanted tacos.
First time here.  Pleasantly surprised.   Had a California burrito, was delicious and all ingredients were fresh.

My 20 years old son visiting from New York discovered this little gem near out house and highly recommended it. We finally made it there for the first time and absolutely loved the little place. I could say it was The Best Mexican Tacos I have ever had!! We highly recommend this place. The place is clean and the food is delicious, portions are generous and prices are fair. It is open 24/7. You will love this place.

Apache Tacos...jump on it ...jump on it! Haha when ever I think about this place I think of that Sugar Hill Gang song Apache. It's my feeling when we go out for tacos.. Jump on it! I love their carne asada soft tacos...delicious! I typically get the 2 taco plate with just rice. I've been here on quite a few occasions so I can tell you that their rolled tacos are no joke. It doesn't look like those pre frozen rolled tacos you get elsewhere. They roll them up fat and it comes with guacamole and sour cream with no extra charges. The fish tacos are fried which I love because a lot of places just do grilled (healthier) but it doesn't taste good to me. I need my fish tacos fried! The carne asada fries are made with steak fries . I like the fact they are not drenched with grease when I get them.  Everything is made fresh so it feels healthier eating Mexican food. I can walk out of there full and have zero guilt! Please be patient though because it's typically just one person working the register and making your food.

I'm here right now..third time this week. Small but clean and newly renovated ...the food is outrageously good..I have had their carne asada torta(my favorite), carne asada buritto and the adobada buritto , bean and cheese burrito(best I ever had) and now the breakfast burrito( not big but still good) and horchata . Everything is great and you can definitely tell its fresh. There salsa is also freshly made everyday ..its a little hidden between the 76  gas station and creative kids learning center.

Best fish tacos I have found in Las Vegas, hands down. 

Seriously killer fish tacos, large crunchy and with perfect zing. If you don't like spicy salsa it might be a bit on the spicy side.

Salsa bar has some really good salsa selections and they are always fresh.

Seating is limited but you can order pickup for a great taco night.

So happy to find good tacos on the west side of town. My boo and I came here on a Wednesday around 6pm, no line or wait for food which was nice. The inside is pretty small, but there are a few tables for sitting and enjoying inside. I also noticed they had a sign stating that they deliver. 

My boo went with one abodada and one carnitas taco while I had the fish tacos plate. I tried his which were pretty good, but I'm still pretty partial to tacos el gordo. The fish tacos though were banging! They had a delicious hickory sauce on top and were huge portions. I'd highly recommend these! 

Overall I was pretty happy with this place and hope to try some more of their menu options. Another tasty spot for quick Mexican food!
Best carne asada tacos and burritos!! I've been twice in one week cuz it's very addicting. The food tastes fresh and the staff is super nice!

Food was really good my only complaint is that if you want cheese and guac on your rolled tacos its gonna cost you and extra 3.50 I just cant stomach paying almost 8 bucks on three rolled tacos.. the torta was good and good priced I just cant get over 23 bucks for 2 orders of rolled tacos and a torta..that's crazy!

The BEST FISH TACO I have ever had in Las Vegas! Crunchy, tasty, spicy, perfect!

Lengua was amazing as well, big chunks of meat in my taco!

Only 4 stars though cause rice and salsa's were lacking flavor ... And they forgot my beans.... but I will definitely be coming bacon
Gotta try the carne asada fries! Not like your typical fries like you get from Roberto's or Don Tortaco. Owners or very nice as well.

If there was ever a place that deserved a 3.5 star rating Apache Taco Shop would be it. I'd have to say that their salsa bar is easily the stand out at Apache. They make a mean tomatillo sauce with a whallop of flavor and just enough heat to get the nose running. As for the rest, nothing spectacular.

After trying their carne asade I'd have to say I'm not a fan. It's just flat out bland compared to the other meats they have. I'd personally stick with the chicken. The chicken is heavily seasoned and goes well with the sauces they offer and their style of burrito.

Their burritos are not made like your average run of the mill burritos. The only ingredients that they put in their burritos are the meat of your choice, beans, rice, and pico de gallo. No cheese, lettuce, sour cream, or guacamole. For an additional charge you can add those extras on. But sitting at under five dollars a burrito, you can't really complain much.

Not a bad spot to grab a burrito during your lunch break but don't expect to have your mind blown.

Small little taco shop. Food is great and the workers are fabulous. My family and I come here at least once a week (that should speak for itself. Lol.)  The Apache fries are my fave it comes with a spicy sauce on the side that is delicious.

I am a Mexican food connoisseur and I have eaten from 5 star to 1 star. And I'm sorry to say that this place did not cut the mustard. The only reason they are getting the extra star is the lady was very friendly. I always try the carne asada burrito at a new place and my one pet peeve is meat quality. Every single bite I took , the meat was fatty and just plain poor quality. I spit out at least 5 bites and frankly I was not pleased. I don't care if you want to charge me more money don't serve me garbage it's disgusting,unpleasant and petty.  Invest in quality and you will earn loyalty. With this you earn nothing but bad word of mouth. Not much else to say.

Only giving it 3 because the price. 2 tacos cost me 8 bucks. One burrito is 7 bucks I feel like I got ripped off even though the tacos were some of the best tacos I've ever had. No grease like every Roberts I've ever been too and the seasoning is perfect. I don't know why anybody be would go to robertos knowing this place exists.

Had their Carne Asada fries. Came with a "fry sauce" that was very unique and added a kick to the flavors. Went there again last night and they had there doors locked. It was 7pm and they close at 10pm. Went across the street to Cafe Rio to fill my Mexican craving and on the way home passed by and they were open... SAD FACE!
Decent food, not as good as most reviews make it sound. Rice & beans were both tasteless.  Although the fish taco was good we wouldn't go back.

Soooo good.  Highly recommend this to anyone if they want a baller taco ! 24 hours too....this is dangerous so close by.  Try the marlin tacos! or the shrimp or anything really its all crazy good. And holy eff the sauces...the sauces.

Holy Apache tacos! Was pleadingly surprised at how good this taco joint was. Tiny hole in the wall. Decided to check it out for lunch. I tried the enchilada plate, which was tasty, and the bf got the carne asada burrito. The carne asada was marinated in some delicious sauce cause the flavor was on point. Only weird thing is they are a little stingy with the salsa/hot sauce bar. There's a giant sign that says 'one serving only' haha. Weird, but good.

Very good! Hidden little spot with good homemade food. The beans were not like the traditional taco shop as you could tell they were freshly made and I think they may throw some people off. I really enjoyed them. I got the carne asada tacos and the meat was perfectly seasoned. Good enough to eat on its own. My son got a hard shell taco, I wasn't a fan because the shell was premade shell. But my son enjoyed it. My daughter got a quesadilla and it was an average quesadilla. Can't really go wrong with a quesadilla. BUT the highlight truly was the salsas!! Each one was delicious. The green starts mild and has a good kick after. The chunkier salsa (not the pico) was so flavorful I could have eaten spoonfuls of it. 

If you are in the area it is worth a stop. And they have bottled Coke!!!

I am so picky about my mexican food it's not even funny. If this review were based on the excellent customer service it would be a 5-star-er. Their carnitas taco was to die for should have probably ordered like 5 of them. Didn't like the carne asada at all, a weird flavor and was super chewy.

Very clean restaurant. It is very small so you may want to get take out and call ahead. Service was quick and friendly. I ordered the fish taco which was very spicy! Excellent sauce. Even as take out it stayed really fresh. The chicken taco was great as well. I would definitely go back and get it again. Would love to see how good everything else is!

Awesome little place! My girlfriend and I showed up at about 11:45pm, and it was packed!

We shared a breakfast burrito and carne asada fries. Both were great. The carne asada had some awesome spices and a lot of flavor. The meat was on the tough side, but still good. The fries had a nice crisp to them, and actually tasted like they were made from real potatoes. The carne asada fries came with this spicy yellow sauce that was perfect. The breakfast burrito was also great. It just tasted fresh and like it was made from quality ingredients. Overall, I'd say that the food was just very solid and well done.

I loved that the prices were so reasonable. Most things were around six or seven bucks, and you get a pretty big portion with that price. Such a value makes me happy.

The service was great. It's hard to put my finger on it, but I just got the feeling like it was a small business that was owned by someone who takes pride in being honest and doing things the right way.

One example: we ordered a horchata, I wasn't sure if there were free refills, so I went up and said something like, "You guys don't offer free refills, do you?". The guy said that normally it's just for soft drinks but he'll give us a refill anyway.

One last tidbit: I love that they're open 24/7. As someone who grew up in New York, I hate it when it's 9pm and I can't find anything to eat. I love knowing that I have a solid late night option for food.

Best carne Asada tacos hands down. 
I'm not sure how this guy marinates his meat but it makes it tender and not chewy when you bite into it. 
Only this is they do take a long time to make your food. I wish the process was a bit quicker. I been here about ten times. Sometimes they don't cook my tortilla all the way. 
But that's a minor detail

Tried this place for the first time and it's actually pretty delicious!! We ordered a couple cheese quesadillas and a veggie burrito that was huge and will be lunch tomorrow lol...my son ordered 3 of the fish tacos and each taco was packed & looked amazing...I would have tried it but, he's pescatarian and I'm vegetarian....he did say it's his favorite thing there to get and now mine, is the veggie burrito, it fills you up and you won't need to eat til tomorrow lol  thanks guys
We had the Carnitas wet burrito and lingua quesadilla, it was terrific. Friendly staff and wonderful place to stop. Thank you so much!! Happy New Years!!

Had to take 4 fish tacos home today after we only ordered 2 because the lady screwed up (this was part of a hefty order of other items..so...how should I eat this all..?). She still had us pay for 4 tacos... And my husband trying to avoid her getting in trouble told her it was fine and paid for 4 tacos. 

We also got a carne asada burrito with lovely burnt char on the inside, you know, for extra flavor. (See pic)

We've been loyal customers for a while and haven't touched other Mexican places after we found this one, but they always seem to get things wrong.. always forgetting my sauce for the asada fries and the carne asada meat is chewy af on fries...so I ordered Al pastor fries suggested by the lady cashier.. why is it so tangy?

Went on a date here with my husband and the SALSAS ARE TO DIE FOR . Its a small place but feels so homie the customer service was amazing and we saw so many people come in and out we literally stay so close I had a torta with chips and salsa the chips where made right there and where so delicious and warm . My husband had NACHOS of course and he loved them . They also are open 24/7 and deliver which is a HUGE PLUS
Really enjoyed the carne asada California burrito. Affordable and good spot when you're craving something other than the usual tex mex you find in the area.

IF YOU ARE LIKE ME AND CURIOUS TO SEE IF THIS SPOT IS ANY GOOD, DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!! GO TO ROBERTO'S INSTEAD!

I ordered a carne asada burrito and I must say it was the most disgusting carne asada I've ever tasted. It's ridiculously juicy and does not taste authentic.

On top of that when I complained and asked for my money back thinking that they care to retain customers I was denied and lectured then told by the owner that he isn't in the social service business lol. I was thinking that I just caught them at a bad time by coming 30 mins before closing, but now I know they don't care to please their customers.

Came here in the middle of the night after a gym session (3 am ish?) cuz it was the only 24 hr Mexican place around. I was the only customer there. Service was good; they bring the food to you and clean up your mess like in a restaurant. 

I knocked off two stars for the food. I ordered a carne asada plate. I was happy with the big portion but the meat was just so tough/over cooked. I didn't want to leave a plate with a bunch of left over meat, especially since I was the only one eating there, so I really tried hard to swallow as much of the meat as I could. My two temples actually started getting numb and my jaw was tiring out so I had to give up. That's how tough the meat was. The rice wasn't really heated at all either. I did enjoy the bowl of beans and the guac side though. 

I will come back another time and order the same thing again and see if it's improved to change my rating. I do hope what I experienced is not a usual thing.

Had the fish tacos and they are delicious!!!! The best I has had her in Vegas. Gabriel was so nice he has wonderful customer service. They have a customer for life. Carne Assad fries and tacos are also delicious . Can't wait to try more items on the menu

We ordered delivery. Got 2 Carne Asada plates We got it within less than 30 minutes. We also ordered a water bottle and a Coke But they forgot my water.I thought the food was really good so I didn't mind. A few minutes later they rang out doorbell and delivered my water. I was really impressed because they didn't have to go back to the restaurant just to get my water. Amazing costumer service. Looks like I'll be a regular and I definitely recommend!

Holy Guacamole!  Best tacos in Vegas!  Now I've eaten Mexican food all over town.  From Roberto's to the "high end" spots.  Hands down this tiny little spot tastes like homemade Mexican food!  

We stopped in for a "snack" so Cesar Q and I each ordered 2 tacos.  For me, I had a fish taco and a carnitas (pork) taco.  Both were incredible and I honestly can't say which one I liked better!  The fish taco was so good and huge too!  It was dressed with fresh pico style salsa and a "chipotlesque" sauce. I added some of there fresh green sauce from the salsa cart for added spice.  The carnitas taco was incredible!  It was dresses with guacamole and fresh chopped onion and cilantro.  I added more of the spicy green sauce and olè!  The guac was fresh and great!  

I am sold on this place.  The hubs and I are considering an evening run to this little gem.  Prices are beyond reasonable.  They offer everything you can imagine!  Even tongue!  No, not an option for me but I am sure my dad would enjoy!

It's a guarantee we will hit this spot up again and again.  You can't beat the prices and the service is great.  The man who cooked and served us was friendly and genuine.

This tiny spot doesn't have much seating but that doesn't matter.  There was seating for 4 and a few tables for 2.  The location couldn't be any better as its on the SW corner of Sahara and Ft. Apache just passed the gas station.

We need more restaurants like this in Las Vegas!  Family run and quality ingredients with reasonable prices!

My 6th time here. I love this shop! My go to is the hard shell taco with carnitas. Damn delicious. And beautiful presentation.Every purchase is made to order fresh. Worth the short time to make. Very delicious. Hours are great for those of us who work nights (open at 7am). Also they have a great selection of custom sauces (including an extreme hot which is legit). Will continue to be a staple for me.

Hand rolled rolled tacos. Delicious! The quesadilla was smaller than I expected, but excellent. All of the sauces and salsas were really good. It is a little tough to get out of at rush hour, but still, it is worth it.

Omg this place is amazing!!! Just went for some street tacos and got a flavorful meal!!! I got 2 carne asada street tacos, 1 fish taco, and side of rice. The carne asada tacos were great. Super flavorful. Cooked just right. The fish taco had a chipotle like taste, full with toppings that added extra flavor. The rice was okay. Had a tomato taste. But I added some my carne asada meat from my taco and hot sauce and it mad it even more delicious. My whole meal was $9. Super affordable. Only thing is they don't have a drive thru but their sign says it's open 24/7. So worth goin down and getting it. Plus they cook quick!!!
I've lives in the lakes for 5 years and always went to Roberto's. I've really been missing out. Best taco shop I've been to!!! Amazing service and yummy food

I needed a quick bite and decided to give this little taco shop a try. Glad I did. It's very small but clean and the food was good. Fresh, tasty and they have excellent customer service!! I'll be coming here again - good job.

I live right by here so I had high hopes, unfortunately with so many other better Mexican places around town I probably won't be back. 

The carne asada burrito was very light on the meat, and it was a little dry and bland. At one point I actually spit some out because I couldn't chew it.

The service was good though. I hate to knock on new small businesses but hopefully you can use this feedback to improve.

Great little spot for some traditional tacos and Mexican food. It's located on the Southwest corner of Sahara and Fort Apache. It reminds me of Roberto's taco shop except better. They are open 24 hours which is a bonus. I never knew they were there until recently which tells me if more people knew about this place it would be a lot busier. Give them a shot.

This little place is soooo good. They have a great variety of foods on the menu and everything Ive tried is killer! Today, we had the huevos rancheros and the mini tacos. If youve not been here, you need too. It's open 24/7 and fabulous

The quality of food that is prepped and cooked here is on par from my great grandma's cooking. I miss her cooking dearly and her touch to Mexican food stemmed from the heart of Guadalajara. Gabriel is top-notch when it comes to cooking the food here. He follows no recipes and allows his palette for delicious flavors to be the deciding factor of serving his food. 

I always ask for 'birria' meat for any of the dishes I order. My wife always gets the fish tacos and I go for the wet burritos. The quesadillas are generously sized and aren't dry. The enchiladas are salacious and the chilaquiles reminds me of family's cooking. 

This restaurant restores pride in my Mexican ethnicity.

The best damn taco joint in Summerlin. I found this place on a whim when I typed in street tacos near my work for lunch one day. I'm so glad I did and found this place! He staff is always so friendly and the food is always hot and fresh. You can tell they buy premium ingredients as it shows in the finished product. I am hooked on their carne asada taco plate because the seasoning they use for the carne asada is next level! The rice is also really good and flavorful. One thing I don't like and it's no fault of their own is the beans. I'm not a fan so I opt for double rice! Give this place a shot! You won't be disappointed

Excellent customer service! Food was good. Honey had a chimichanga & I had rolled tacos. Guac is yummy, salsa a bit too spicy for me. Pico was spicier than most places. We'll be trying this one again to taste some of the other menu offerings for sure (like those carne asada fries)
My new favorite place! Not only were the tacos better then the ones we had in Cabo Mexico, but the "mom and pops" of the place are genuinely nice people! Will drive out of the way to go here!

Let's TACO bout Apache...in my opinion it's the best taco place in the Summerlin area for sure! I've been going here for a while now and there's just something about their carne asada tacos that just keeps me & my bf coming back! They've also recently changed their hours to be open 24 hours 7 days a week, which is perfect for those craving a late night snack or maybe after a night of drinking! Haha we also usually get the carne asada fries with a side of pico de gallo (50 cents extra) but today they forgot to give it to me in my to-go order and I didn't notice until I was already on the road so I had to drive all the way back. But other than that, the owners here are also very welcoming and I love how they have a fresh salsa bar! If you want no fuss, straight up delicious & tender carne asada tacos, definitely try it out!

Horrible just horrible : I couldn't finish my fish taco and based on the fish taco I had I threw the fish burrito in the trash. The fish was rubbery and the sauce was overwhelming and not in a good way

I will be honest and say that while I do come here every so often, it is to only ever get one thing: SHRIMP TACOS. The taco size itself is sizable and the portions of shrimp and all the dressings are very generous.
