The sweetness of the battered shrimp, with the tanginess of the dressings, topped with their spicy free salsa (3 kinds) is so delicious and flavorful. 

They are open 24/7 and always greet you warmly with a smile; and I've been here both in the middle of the afternoon and late at night.
Love this place . Me and coworkers go two or three times a week . Owner and wife are very kind sweet . If you have not been try the pita taco carnitas. You will full in love
I just have to add.. I HATE beans.. but the beans here are so good! I finish it every time! I don't know what sauces they use here for everything, but it never disappoints!

The food was very good. I got the lengua taco, carne Asada taco, and the carne Asada nachos! Food took a little longer, but you can tell that everything was very fresh and made to order. The environment was clean, and the salsa bar was very clean and well stocked . The carne asada nachos are a must ! Fresh guacamole and pico de Gallo with Smokey carne asada! The tacos were full of flavor , and the lengua was very tender. They ran out of cabeza tacos but I look forward to going back again soon! Service was great, nice and polite !
I sat down and ate here and wanted to buy more; they still wanted to charge me an extra 75 cents for another order. I JUST PLACED AN ORDER AND YOU WANT TO CHARGE ME AGAIN? What a load of poop.

This is a little tiny place with not a whole lot of room to sit but some tasty tacos. We stopped in here on Saturday evening to finish off our pub crawl. There is one four top to sit at, a couple of two tops and a bar to sit at. We needed the four top and luckily the people ahead of us left. Good smells flowing from the kitchen made my taste buds perk up!

Both my brother in law and I opted for the taco plate. I had a fish and pollo taco and he had the carne asada. My hubby ordered the enchiladas. We enjoyed some chips and salsa too. Their salsa is really flavorful and they offer both hot and mild. I tried all of them and really liked the one that had a smoked taste and a nice kick at the end. Just a hole in the wall with some very authentic tasting Mexican food. I have driven by multiple times and never even noticed this place but it is on my radar for another try.

5 stars for the food. 3 for the service, only because the wait when you go in late night is pretty long. But it's totally worth it. The food is so fresh and delicious. Way better quality than Roberto's. Spicier too. The guy at night is the cashier as well as the cook. He is super nice and clearly gets his hustle on. Next time I want to get late night Mexican without hating myself the next day, this is my spot.
Lived in South Texas for 20 plus years. This place has got it together. 24/7 and they deliver! Best Mexican food. 6 types of salsa all made in house. No TX/Mex. All made when you order.

Cant believe that this shop serves such good food 24 hours, at a reasonable price. 

The food is freshly cooked even in the wee hours of the morning. I had the adobada tacos and they were extremely generous with the delicious marinated meat to the point where the tacos were overflowing.

The salsas do not skimp on the heat, which I appreciate. The creamy spicy avocado salsa was my favorite.

Also, the staff is just super nice, even at 6 AM. The guy who cooks everything brought us a plate when he saw us start to eat our to go order at the counter. So considerate!

This shop is so legit and so amazingly good. We ended up going to this place three times in our 5 day trip to Vegas. Staffed by hardworking, caring people and so delicious.

This is the quintessential mom and pop shop. Stopped by for fish tacos to go on Sat, my second time, and was helped by the older couple who own the place. They were extremely nice people. After bragging to my wife about how huge and tasty the fish tacos were, she wanted me to go back the next day to get her one. I came back and was helped by their son, and had a nice chat with him too.  He offered me a taste of their braised beef and it was melt-in-your-mouth tender. (Have to wait until next time to get this, since I already pre-ordered). My wife, who doesn't particularly favor Mexican food, loved the fish tacos. 

Can't get a better taco or deal anywhere than this place, particularly the fish tacos. You should order on your way there since they make these to order and it takes at least 10 min to fry. This is a great little neighborhood treasure and a great family-owned, authentic taco spot.

Now THIS is a Fish Taco :D 

Fried fresh when you order it, the fish taco is crispy, golden, flakey and all around just plain delicious! It's also HUGE....like, literally-cannot-fit-in-my mouth huge! I probably haven't had such a good fish taco since The Best Fish Taco in Ensanada.  It comes in a double corn tortilla and topped generously with pico de gallo (which is very jalapeno heavy), shredded cabbage and sauce. 

I also ordered Carne Asada Fries, because...well, I'm a fatty.  Sadly, these fries were not nearly as great as the fish tacos. In fact, they were pretty bad - salty and with not much on it, just meat and cheese. No guac in sight! No onions. Meat was overly salty and kinda reminiscent of ground beef....bleh

The salsa bar is super fresh, but not for the faint of heart! Stay away from the pale green sauce unless you want to die a fiery spicy death....my mouth still hurts so bad....

Service is friendly, but like previously mentioned by Stephany V, it's a one man show, so this is definitely not fast food.  Mexican telenovellas playing on the TV give the place an authentic feel :)
Best fish tacos, not fishy at all.  I have passed it a million times until a friend told me to try it.  We went last night and we all loved it, hot, fresh, authentic.
Worst  Mexican I've ever had..they used old grease..i got taquitos and hard shell tacos rice and beans..shells were burnt ..and beans had a chemical taste to them..
